snippet.textDisplay: Pro tip, If you die and have to respawn, you will respawn at the closest spawning location.  For a boss that is usually right before the entrance.  Now, if you were to pause the game and quit, you will also respawn at that same location.  When you go down and miss your second wind and begin to transport back to the respawning station, you will not be charged that 10% until you are spit out on the other side. So with that in mind, when you miss your second wind and you are certain you are going to the respawning station, just pause, quit the game and hit continue.  You will not lose your money and you will respawn at the same location.  There is no penalty for doing this.  Its the same as dashboarding on the original xbox. All you lose is time, like 30 seconds to quit and reload.  I can understand for those who are in the heat of battle want to jump right back in but you save a great deal of money in the later bosses by doing this.  Like a WHOLE HECK OF A LOT OF MONEY! LoL
snippet.textOriginal: Pro tip, If you die and have to respawn, you will respawn at the closest spawning location.  For a boss that is usually right before the entrance.  Now, if you were to pause the game and quit, you will also respawn at that same location.  When you go down and miss your second wind and begin to transport back to the respawning station, you will not be charged that 10% until you are spit out on the other side. So with that in mind, when you miss your second wind and you are certain you are going to the respawning station, just pause, quit the game and hit continue.  You will not lose your money and you will respawn at the same location.  There is no penalty for doing this.  Its the same as dashboarding on the original xbox. All you lose is time, like 30 seconds to quit and reload.  I can understand for those who are in the heat of battle want to jump right back in but you save a great deal of money in the later bosses by doing this.  Like a WHOLE HECK OF A LOT OF MONEY! LoL

snippet.textDisplay: The idea of money being an issue in a borderlands game is laughable. Especially in 4. Every single boss farm is a net positive for cash. Even tipping Moxie a million bucks nets you back about 10 million in legendary guns. Even after buying well over 20 lvl 50 vending machine weapons, I still have about 50mil on hand.
snippet.textOriginal: The idea of money being an issue in a borderlands game is laughable. Especially in 4. Every single boss farm is a net positive for cash. Even tipping Moxie a million bucks nets you back about 10 million in legendary guns. Even after buying well over 20 lvl 50 vending machine weapons, I still have about 50mil on hand.

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't know what's causing it but I have a vladof sub with a torgue clip and a under barrel flamethrower.
It may be caused by the weapon mod I have giving vladof guns a 30% chance to fire an extra projectile. Basically Whenever I swap from under barrel and back I get an extra projectile and it stacks. This essentially turns the sub into a shotgun and is absolutely broken. I'm wondering if anyone else has noticed or looked into this.
snippet.textOriginal:
I don't know what's causing it but I have a vladof sub with a torgue clip and a under barrel flamethrower.
It may be caused by the weapon mod I have giving vladof guns a 30% chance to fire an extra projectile. Basically Whenever I swap from under barrel and back I get an extra projectile and it stacks. This essentially turns the sub into a shotgun and is absolutely broken. I'm wondering if anyone else has noticed or looked into this.

snippet.textDisplay: if you run off a ledge without jumping you can do 2 midair jumps and then glide. the 50% glider cost reduction also effects how many times you can dodge, though if the game lags you might end up ground pounding instead of dashing in midair.
snippet.textOriginal: if you run off a ledge without jumping you can do 2 midair jumps and then glide. the 50% glider cost reduction also effects how many times you can dodge, though if the game lags you might end up ground pounding instead of dashing in midair.

snippet.textDisplay: I love it. I was playing last night and was doing one of the bunkers or whatever. Was in the middle of the boss at the end, was parkouring around, grabbed an explosive canister to throw while midair, turned, threw it at the guy as he threw his grenade, the two deflected each other blowing up in opposite directions of each other. We both sat for like half a second as his programming caught up and I was like WTF for a second lol, then I slaughtered him with corrosive ammo. My mind was blown for such a small reason. His grenade bouncing off my canister midair. Man that was so cool and felt like a one in a million kinda thing lol. All I want is the D-pad weapon switching back.
snippet.textOriginal: I love it. I was playing last night and was doing one of the bunkers or whatever. Was in the middle of the boss at the end, was parkouring around, grabbed an explosive canister to throw while midair, turned, threw it at the guy as he threw his grenade, the two deflected each other blowing up in opposite directions of each other. We both sat for like half a second as his programming caught up and I was like WTF for a second lol, then I slaughtered him with corrosive ammo. My mind was blown for such a small reason. His grenade bouncing off my canister midair. Man that was so cool and felt like a one in a million kinda thing lol. All I want is the D-pad weapon switching back.
